attributes.action: remove the words "a constable" from Section 76 of the Counter-Terrorism Act 2008
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The Counter-Terrorism Act 2008 allows police officers to prevent photographers taking pictures of them if they believe the pictures might be useful one day to a terrorist.

The referral of two incidents at the recent London G20 demonstrations to the Independent Police Complaints Commission was as a result of photographic evidence gathered by onlookers.

This vital evidence collection could have been stopped at any time by a police officer using his powers under the 2008 Act.

Section 76 is a clear conflict of interest and gives police officers a tool to prevent appropriate scrutiny of their conduct.
